This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"reduceContentAmounts(uint256,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)":{"params":{"amounts":"amounts of contentIds","assetId":"existing assetId to reduce its consumed contentIds","contentIds":"contentIds whose amounts to be reduced","data":"refer - ERC1155 _mint"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. params.assetId: Id of asset to add contents to
params.contentIds: Id's of assets which will be consumed

getAssetContent(uint256).details: contents are assetIds whhich where consumed to mint assetId

returns._0: returns the unique file storage identifier of the assets contents if available

mint(uint256,bytes32,bytes32,uint256[],u.details: contentIds are previously minted assets which are consumed to mint new asset each contentId must have its amount in amounts

params.contentIds: assets to consume / lock inorder to mint new asset
params.externalContentRef: (optional) unique file storage id of the file (eg json) that stores the contents of the asset
params.name: Name of asset

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.assetId: existing assetId to reduce its consumed contentIds
params.contentIds: contentIds whose amounts to be reduced

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._externalContentRef: unique file storage identifier of asset content file

setMaxContentPerTransaction(uint256).details: this is a protetion mechanism to prevent too many contentIds passed to the consume or mint transaction

params._value: maximum number of assets (contentIds) that can be consumed in a transaction

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

assetExists(uint256).notice: checks if assetId exists in memory

batchTransferFrom(address,uint256[],uint.notice: batch transfer from sender to receiver `to` address

getAssetContentIndex(uint256,uint256).notice: returns the index of the content

getAssetContentIndexWithRevert(uint256,u.notice: returns the index of the content. Reverts if the contentId is not a content of the asset

getContentCount(uint256).notice: returns count of the content of the asset

isAssetOwner(uint256,address).notice: checks if account owns (is minter) of assetId

reduceContentAmounts(uint256,uint256[],u.notice: Reduces the amount of consumed assets (contentIds) used to mint the specified assetId

transfer(address,uint256,uint256,bytes).notice: transfers assets from sender to `to` address
